summary:
Geoscientist with extensive experience in evaluating geophysical and geological (G&G) data for both regional studies and prospect maturation. Skilled in integrating subsurface data to identify exploration and production opportunities, evaluate subsurface risks, and give technical recommendations that support investment decisions in oil and gas projects.  

I am aware of the challenges as well as the opportunities that the energy transition represents for a developing country like Colombia. As a Geoscientist with an 'Explorer' mindset, I can make a meaningful contribution and that’s why over the next four years, I will work on evaluating the low-carbon energy potential of the Caribbean Region in the country and explore how this potential can be harnessed to achieve Colombia's sustainable development.

Technical support in Farm-in and Farm-out process (Blocks in Putumayo-Caguan, Llanos, Lower Magdalena and Marañon Basins)', 'title': 'Geoscientist Specialist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Pacific Rubiales Energy', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Bogotá D.C., Colombia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Pacific Rubiales Energy', 'description': '2016-2017: Seismic Interpreter for Orito Integrated Project, Putumayo Basin: This project was conducted by a multi-disciplinary team and was focused on integrating sequence stratigraphy, petrophysics and seismic data in order to generate an updated static model for Pepino and Villeta and Caballos Formations. 

2016: Brazil, Foz do Amazonas Basin: Seismic interpretation and evaluation of exploratory opportunities for the block  FZA-M-90

2015: Seismic interpreter for the Hydrogeologic Evaluation Project in Llanos Basin. I was responsible for interpreting all the available seismic and well data in the southern part of Llanos Basin and generating an integrated structural model in order to provide the input for the basin modeling. The goal of this project was to evaluate the hydrodynamic effect on oil migration and trapping in this portion of the basin.

2014: Seismic Interpreter in the Structural and Hydrogeologic Evaluation of the Foothills in the Putumayo Basin Project (The University of Texas at Austin-Pacific Rubiales Energy). This project was conducted by a multi-disciplinary team and included the structural interpretation, timing of oil generation, migration and trapping mechanism with the objective to evaluate the prospectivity throughout the deformed belt.
 

2012-2013: Seismic Interpreter for the Regional Study in Llanos Basin. This work was conducted by a multi-disciplinary team and was focused on integrating well, biostratigraphy, seismic, and petroleum system information in order to generate an updated geological model and identify new exploratory opportunities.

2011: Technical assessment for operated and non-operated blocks in Putumayo Basin. •	Seismic Methods I: The course was designed to familiarize the students with the nature of the seismic data and what it represents. The topics covered are: seismic wave propagation, convolutional model, seismic   resolution,   introduction   to   seismic   data   acquisition   and processing.

•	Seismic  Methods  II:  This  course  was  focused  on structural  and stratigraphic interpretation of 2D and 3D seismic data.

•	Seismic  Reservoir  Characterization:  In  this  course  I  described  the fundamental role of the seismic method in the process of reservoir characterization.
